meanings.definition: To lead or direct in singing or playing music.
meanings.sent1: The choir director precented the group during the performance.
meanings.sent2: She precented the orchestra with confidence and skill.
meanings.sent3: The cat precented a meow symphony in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent4: His fingers precented a melody that touched the hearts of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The conductor precented the music with passion and precision.

meanings.definition: To set the pitch for a group of singers or musicians.
meanings.sent1: The pianist precented the correct pitch for the choir to follow.
meanings.sent2: He precented the starting note for the acapella group.
meanings.sent3: The parrot precented a high pitch that made everyone cover their ears.
meanings.sent4: Her voice precented the perfect pitch that resonated throughout the hall.
meanings.sent5: The tuning fork precented a clear pitch for the musicians to tune their instruments.
